div.h3:
Latest Info & Updates during COVID-19 shutdown
Rutherford County Schools remains closed through Friday, April 24 as a precaution during the COVID-19 situation. Find the latest information about closures, the free food program for students, distance learning plan and more.

img.alt: RCS expands free food program to 26 sites during shutdown Thumbnail Image

h1.a: RCS expands free food program to 26 sites during shutdown

article.div: Rutherford County Schools will provide breakfast, lunch for students, families in need while district is closed over concerns related to COVID-19

article.div: School counselor makes hundreds of free facemasks for medical personnel

article.div: National initiative to bring engineering courses to high school students expands to Rutherford County; interested Riverdale students encouraged to reach out now to enroll

h1.a: MTSU, Rutherford County Schools to reschedule high school graduation ceremonies

article.div: Middle Tennessee State University and Rutherford County Schools jointly announced that high school graduation ceremonies set for May in MTSU’s Murphy Center will be rescheduled later this summer — if public health guidelines permit — due to concerns stemming from the COVID-19 outbreak.
